item.description:
This is posted as an FYI for P-Collective members that might be interested.

The RISD Museum will host a free screening of "Make No Little Plans: Daniel Burnham and the American City".

"Few architects have had more impact on the American city than Daniel Burnham, generally acknowledged as the father of Urban Planning. His vision of a civilized city during the late 19th century launched the City Beautiful movement in America."

This film is being shown as part of a larger conference by the Providence Preservation Society & AIAri this Friday and Saturday (September 15 & 16) called "Make No Little Plans: A symposium on vsions for the City of Providence". If you want to know more about the history of out beautiful city and where its going in the future you may want to consider attending.

For more information on the Symposium and the movie, click here: http://providencesymposium.com/

Note that there is parking around the museum and on North Main street past XO Cafe and near the park, but there may also be parking on South Main near the cable car. Just drive around, you'll find something eventually!
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be wearng some kind of silver flower or headband.
item.name: Movie Screening: "Make No Little Plans: Daniel Burnham and the American City"
